description.narrative:
The objective of this project is to promote investigative journalism stories, with and through Africa's cooperation with Dutch journalists. Many thinkers on development give high priority to increasing the downward and upward accountability of governance, government and trade and industry towards the population of developing countries. That justification is needed for good governance and social development. Investigative journalism can play a major role, especially regarding this accountability. This project will contribute to greater accountability of African and foreign governments towards their people and also contribute to a more nuanced image of Africa and its relevant themes in the Netherlands.
In the short term, this project focuses on promoting close cooperation between journalists from the Netherlands and African journalists. As a pilot project, Free Press Unlimited will both manage a small fund for experiments and assess requests for the "Cooperation Fund" as per the 1st of March 2014. This fund will give financial support of 5,000 euro’s at most per application to up to seven applicants from the Dutch media. The application must be submitted together with ajournalist from Africa and publication must be guaranteed beforehand. Applications will be assessed by a committee consisting of representatives from Free Press Unlimited, Oxfam Novib and investigative journalists with good reputations.
The pilot projects will be supervised by Dutch experts who will monitor the pilot programs and coach parties should this be needed. When reporting on the project, the assessment and findings of the selection committee and the experts will be included in the final report by Free Press Unlimited to Oxfam Novib in order to learn from the implementation of this pilot project for the future. Case studies will be developed,which will serve as the basis for further roll-out of the multiannual program and will be presented at seminars in September (NL) and December (Africa).

participating-org.narrative:
Free Press Unlimited (FPU) is a foundation based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. FPU has a dedicated team of some 50 professionals.FPU has media projects in 39 countries around the world and believes that objective information can be of life-and-death importance. Free Press Unlimited helps local journalists in war zones and conflict areas to provide their audience with trustworthy news and information. The information that people need to survive and give shape to their own future.
Freedom of the Press and Freedom of Information are vital for gathering and spreading reliable, unbiased information. Media play a crucial role in providing people free and unrestricted access to information that can help them develop and monitor the authorities. Free Press Unlimited wants to make andkeep objective news and information available to everyone, especially to people in countries without or with limited (press) freedom.
By supporting local media professionals and journalists, FPU wants to help people gain and keep access to the information they need to survive and develop.
Support is given in the following ways: Protection of Journalists, Training for media professionals and journalists, conflict reporting, Journalim and innovation, media for children and adolescents, platform for minority perspectives.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
